intro: Fibigia tabriziana, commonly known as the Tabriz velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to tolerate drought conditions. Fibigia tabriziana is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
